Commentary: Russell to Simmons, no run, short of length delivery outside off, punched to cover point
Russell to Simmons, no run, cuts him into two halves. This one nips back in to sneak through the gap between bat and pad, flies over the stumps. Quality delivery
Russell to Simmons, 1 run, gets a thick inside edge to mid-on, they scamper through for a quick single. A direct hit and Simmons would've been walking back
Russell to Vince, no run, gets forward and bunts it to cover
Russell to Vince, no run, slower and fuller on off, driven to mid-off
Russell to Vince, 1 run, short on middle, he muscles the pull, one bounce to the man at deep square
Imran Khalid to Vince, no run, too short to start off with, makes room and punches it straight to cover
Imran Khalid to Vince, no run, steps out and crunches it to point
Imran Khalid to Vince, no run, fired into middle and leg, looks to whip it past square leg, hit high on the pad

Imran Khalid to Vince, OUT, flays that through to cover point where Zaidi stops that brilliantly by diving full length to his right, recovers quickly and fires a throw to the wicketkeeper's end, Simmons wasn't even in the frame. Total confusion there, but the wicket was brought about because of an outstanding effort on the field
Imran Khalid to Imad Wasim, no run, spins back into middle and leg, he's hit on the pad as he looks to work it wide of square leg
Imran Khalid to Imad Wasim, no run, punched wide of cover, excellent stop. Wicket maiden
Mohammad Sami to Vince, no run, back of length delivery on middle, pushed back to the bowler
Mohammad Sami to Vince, no run, gives him the charge and slaps it to mid-off, Russell does well to stop that bullet hit, hesitation in the running again
Mohammad Sami to Vince, 1 run, looks to loft him over mid-on, toe ends it to the fielder, they get through for the single
Mohammad Sami to Imad Wasim, no run, swing and a miss. Looks to thrash that over point, too early into the stroke
Mohammad Sami to Imad Wasim, no run, flirts at the length delivery slanting away, late on the stroke, didn't miss the edge by much
Mohammad Sami to Imad Wasim, no run, another swing, another miss. No feet movement whatsoever as he looks to go over cover

Saeed Ajmal to Vince, OUT, he's struck gold first ball. Gets some drift, pitches on off, breaks back in sharply, gets a bit of fizz as well, Vince looks to whip it past midwicket, is a touch late on the stroke and is trapped plumb in front. Would've crashed into middle and leg. Ajmal is delighted, his team mates are unstoppable. What a start this by Islamabad United
Saeed Ajmal to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, gets to the pitch of the ball and works it down to long on
Wicket: ['JM Vince lbw b Saeed Ajmal 2 (11b 0x4 0x6) SR: 18.18']

Commentary: Saeed Ajmal to Imad Wasim, FOUR, sees the flight, his eyes light up as he steps out and hammers it back over the bowler's head. It wasn't too far away from the umpire. He had to take evasive action very quickly
Saeed Ajmal to Imad Wasim, FOUR, stand and deliver. Sees the width and latches onto that one. Hammered into the gap between cover and mid-off

Saeed Ajmal to Imad Wasim, FOUR, sliced away, between cover and point this time. Sami, running back, did extremely well to dive full length forward, but the ball was in contact with the rope as he tried to pull it back. Suddenly, there's a lot of pressure on Pakistan's premier spinner
Saeed Ajmal to Imad Wasim, 1 run, works it round the corner towards deep midwicket
Rumman Raees to Imad Wasim, 1 run, mistimes a lofted hit to mid-on, but they scoot across for a single
Rumman Raees to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, whipped away off his hip to deep square

Rumman Raees to Imad Wasim, FOUR, wonderful stroke. This one was a half-volley outside off, bat nicely down, nice high elbow, opened the blade a touch to piece the gap between cover and mid-off. Delightful timing. Wasim is on a roll
Rumman Raees to Imad Wasim, 1 run, arches back and dabs it down to third man
Rumman Raees to Shoaib Malik, no run, back of length delivery on middle, pushed back to the bowler
Rumman Raees to Shoaib Malik, no run, dabbed back down the wicket
Watson to Imad Wasim, 1 run, sashays down the pitch and goes over cover, there's a boundary rider in the deep though
Watson to Shoaib Malik, no run, nearly chopped back onto the stumps
Watson to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, bunted to point, bit of hesitation but Malik eventually managed to get through
Watson to Imad Wasim, FOUR, mistimes the pull, ball gets big on him, gets it high on the bat, Raes at fine leg was running back and couldn't hold on. Opportunity missed, you have to say
Watson to Imad Wasim, FOUR, slapped away with disdain. Steps out and flat bats him over mid-off, one bounce into the boundary
Watson to Imad Wasim, 1 run, gets to the pitch of the ball and strokes it to mid-off, untidy effort by the fielder who fires a wayward throw at the bowler's end, one for the overthrow

Russell to Imad Wasim, OUT, excellent delivery, excellent catch. Bowls a cutter on off again, Wasim looks to run it down but manages to get a thick edge that is nicely pouched by Sam Billings diving low to his left. That should rejuvenate Islamabad.
Russell to Shakib Al Hasan, no run, bunts it to point
Russell to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run, crunched towards deep cover, sweet sound as ball met bat
Russell to Shoaib Malik, no run, is half-forward as he pats it to the off side, good control this by Russell
Russell to Shoaib Malik, 1 run, plays a short-arm jab towards deep midwicket
Russell to Shakib Al Hasan, no run, excellent bouncer, targetted on middle, Shakib gets out of the way nicely
Mohammad Sami to Shoaib Malik, no run, floats it just around off, he looks to dab it wide of point but can't get any power or direction on the stroke
Mohammad Sami to Shoaib Malik, 2 runs, gets hold of the pull, the man at deep square leg does well to get around to stop that

Mohammad Sami to Shoaib Malik, OUT, played on! Looks to ease it wide of point again, but has no room to work with and ends up chopping it back onto the off stump. Sami lets out a roar, he knows the value of this wicket. Karachi Kings in trouble
Mohammad Sami to Iftikhar Ahmed, 1 run, pulls it towards deep square to get off the mark
Mohammad Sami to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run, deflected down to third man for an easy single
Mohammad Sami to Iftikhar Ahmed, 2 runs, swivels around and pulls it into the gap between deep square leg and fine leg, did well to get it all along the ground, good work in the deep
Rumman Raees to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run, slower delivery outside off, eased wide of point
Rumman Raees to Iftikhar Ahmed, 1 run, tucked to the left of square leg
Rumman Raees to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run, gets forward and works it wide of short midwicket
Rumman Raees to Iftikhar Ahmed, no run, shows the full face of the bat and defends
Rumman Raees to Iftikhar Ahmed, no run, length ball on middle, nips away a touch, bunted to cover
Rumman Raees to Iftikhar Ahmed, 1 run, back of length delivery on middle and leg, tucked towards short fine leg
Watson to Iftikhar Ahmed, no run, shapes back in a touch, he looks to flay it over cover, gets an inside edge to the on side
Watson to Iftikhar Ahmed, 1 run, unfurls his wrists to ease it into the point region, stopped by the boundary rider
Watson to Shakib Al Hasan, no run, floats it full and straight on middle, squeezed back to the bowler, good stop on his followthrough
Watson to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run, backs away to carve one over point, gets a thick outside edge towards third man
Watson to Iftikhar Ahmed, 1 run, slower bouncer outside off, he plays a cross court forehand, gets it down to wide long-on
Watson to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run, slices it down to square third man
Saeed Ajmal to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run, starts off with a straighter one, a touch fuller, driven down to long-off
Saeed Ajmal to Iftikhar Ahmed, no run, steps out but can't get to the pitch, played back to the bowler
Saeed Ajmal to Iftikhar Ahmed, no run, width on offer, zips off he pitch, he shapes to cut but is beaten
Saeed Ajmal to Iftikhar Ahmed, no run, sharp turn back in, hit high on the thigh pad
Saeed Ajmal to Iftikhar Ahmed, 3 runs, round-arm delivery, way outside off, lucky to get away with the half-tracker, slapped into the gap at deep point
Saeed Ajmal to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run, hammered towards deep cover, a touch risky given he exposed all three stumps
Russell to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run, back of length delivery outside off, eased to third man
Russell to Iftikhar Ahmed, 2 runs, mistimes a lofted hit, long-off was running back, looked to go a lot straighter, ended up slicing it, Ajmal does well
Russell to Iftikhar Ahmed, no run, that's hit him on the helmet. He looks to pull, was cramped for room. He was beaten for pace as well. Hit on the grill

Russell to Iftikhar Ahmed, 2 runs, this one's been deposited into the vacant deep midwicket region, two fielders circling around that but landed between them. Got too much elevation as he looked to hit that slower delivery into Abu Dhabi
Russell to Iftikhar Ahmed, 1 bye, cuts and misses. Keeper fumbles, they steal a single
Russell to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run, yorker outside off, squeezed to third man
Rumman Raees to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run, slower one on middle, gets a bit of grip on that, the inside-edge rolls wide of square leg

Rumman Raees to Iftikhar Ahmed, 1 run, Watson's fluffed a chance. Pressure ball, pressure shot. He looks to back away and slap it over point, only ends up lobbing it high in the air, Watson misjudged it completely, in the end, didn't even get a hand on it
Rumman Raees to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run, backs away and helps it wide of short fine leg
Rumman Raees to Iftikhar Ahmed, FOUR, gets a top edge that races away into the fine leg boundary. He tried to go over square leg, but it doesn't matter

Rumman Raees to Iftikhar Ahmed, OUT, so the drop catch doesn't cost them much. Slower bouncer again, looks to pull but was targeting the longer boundary, didn't get that anywhere near the middle, and the deep midwicket fielder takes a dolly. A scratchy innings has come to an end
Rumman Raees to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run, worked towards the man running in from deep midwicket

Mohammad Sami to Shakib Al Hasan, FOUR, wow, what a shot! This one was full and straight on middle, tailing away a touch, Shakib makes a bit of room, angles his bat ever so slightly and squeezes it behind point, tremendous timing, pinged that off the middle
Mohammad Sami to Shakib Al Hasan, no run, hit straight to Watson at cover this time
Mohammad Sami to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run, low full toss outside off, angled down to third man
Wicket: ['Iftikhar Ahmed c Sharjeel Khan b Rumman Raees 19 (20b 1x4 0x6) SR: 95.00']

Commentary: Mohammad Sami to Bopara, 1 run, dabbed wide of third man to get off the mark
Mohammad Sami to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run, square driven to the deep point fielder
Mohammad Sami to Bopara, no run, good last ball, length ball on middle and off, looks to turn it wide of midwicket, can't get enough bat on it
Saeed Ajmal to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run, backs away and swings it down to long on, one bounce to the fielder
Saeed Ajmal to Bopara, FOUR, excellent reverse sweep. This one was full on off but he changed the bat grip and got into good position in quick time. Directed it superbly
Saeed Ajmal to Bopara, 1 run, eased wide of short third man

Saeed Ajmal to Shakib Al Hasan, OUT, he's swept that straight to deep square leg. Looked to play the slog over the ropes there, but turned out to be a flat hit. The fielder in the deep came running in, held his balance, got down on one knee and managed to take the catch even as the momentum of the ball threatened to take him back. Shakib was looking mighty dangerous, that is a big wicket. Is that the clincher?
Saeed Ajmal to Bopara, 1 run, eased to short third man, quick single taken

Saeed Ajmal to Saifullah Bangash, OUT, looks to work it wide of midwicket but gets a leading edge that is superbly taken by the cover fielder running backwards. Another one bites the dust. The wicketkeeper walks back without disturbing the scorers.
Watson to Bopara, 1 run, eased to third man, straight to the fielder but the throw was fired at the bowler's end
Watson to Sohail Tanvir, no run, pushed to cover, the non-striker was long way down the pitch, a direct hit at the bowler's end would have certainly given them a wicket. Kamran Ghulam the fielder
Watson to Sohail Tanvir, no run, swing and a miss. Looks to heave it across the line over midwicket
Wicket: ['Shakib Al Hasan c Imran Khalid b Saeed Ajmal 20 (22b 1x4 0x6) SR: 90.90']

Commentary: Watson to Sohail Tanvir, no run, slower bouncer on middle and leg, he ducks under it thinking it would be called wide, umpire says it's fine
Watson to Sohail Tanvir, 1 run, he comes into play immediately, straight to long off
Watson to Bopara, 1 run, pushed straight to point but they squeeze through for a single
Wicket: ['Saifullah Bangash c Imran Khalid b Saeed Ajmal 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00']

Commentary: Rumman Raees to Bopara, OUT, slower delivery on middle, tucked wide of the bowler, who runs quickly to get to the ball and then turns around to hurl a direct hit at the bowler's end. Tanvir was halfway down the pitch and had no chance of getting back. Superb work by the bowler, tremendous athleticism
Rumman Raees to Bopara, 1 run, flicked off the pad to deep square leg
Rumman Raees to Usama Mir, no run, bunted back to the bowler
Rumman Raees to Usama Mir, no run, looks to pull but is deceived by the slower bouncer, through with the stroke even before the ball got to him
Rumman Raees to Usama Mir, 1 run, tucked away to square leg, no boundary. Pressure building
Rumman Raees to Bopara, 1 run, on the pads, flicked to deep midwicket, good work in the deep
Mohammad Sami to Bopara, 1 run, hit hard but straight to long off
Mohammad Sami to Usama Mir, no run, looks to scoop it away but doesn't come off, they're squeezing this out superbly
Mohammad Sami to Usama Mir, 1 run, makes a bit of room and carves that out to deep cover
Mohammad Sami to Bopara, no run, excellent yorker, pacy one too, he can't get under that one, somehow jams his bat down in time
Mohammad Sami to Bopara, 1 run, crunched towards deep midwicket, no chance of the second
Mohammad Sami to Usama Mir, 1 run, another yorker on middle, played back past the bowler to long off
Russell to Usama Mir, 2 runs, slower ball on middle from wide of the crease, heaved over square, the fielder does well to run back and pull it back in

Russell to Usama Mir, FOUR, misses his length, but by only just. He somehow manages to get under it and drill that over the umpire's head. Bisects long-off and long-on. Is there life in this match yet?
Russell to Usama Mir, 1 run, carved over cover

Russell to Bopara, FOUR, full toss on middle, swung away towards deep midwicket where the fielder parries the ball past the boundary even as he tries to defect it to the fielder who runs across from long-on. Thrilling stuff this
Russell to Bopara, no run, that's a perfect yorker, keeps that out. Best ball of the over. Gold under the circumstances
Russell to Bopara, 2 runs, into the blockhole, manages to get it over the bowler's head, they steal a second even as long-on is late to get off the blocks
Watson to Mohammad Amir, FOUR, gets a thick edge, squeezes it between point and short third man. Streaky, but it doesn't matter. Can Amir be the hero?
Watson to Mohammad Amir, no run, accurate delivery, plays it back towards Watson. Bopara wanted to get across and take strike, Watson pulled out of the throw

Watson to Mohammad Amir, no run, backs away to squeeze that over point, misses the yorker, Bopara nearly ran two even as Amir didn't move an inch. Top work by Sam Billings. Looks like he hit the base of the stumps, but the bails didn't come off. Bizarre
Watson to Mohammad Amir, 1 run, backs away and squeezes it to extra cover

Watson to Bopara, SIX, a high full toss on middle, he swings that over the bowler's head, sails over long-off. Bopara, you beauty! Watson looked to bowl a yorker, missed it by a long way. What timing on that one
Watson to Bopara, 1 run, right into the blockhole, this time he gets it right, Bopara backs away to go over cover, but can only get a thick inside edge onto the pad as the ball rolls to the off side
